required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: AI-Powered Scoliosis Auto-Analysis System Multicenter Development and Validations
clinical_study.official_title: AI-Powered Scoliosis Auto-Analysis System Multicenter Development and Validations

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators aim to use artificial intelligence (AI) to help clinicians in diagnosing and assessing spinal deformities.

detailed_description.textblock:
Background Spinal deformity is a prevalent spinal disorder in both paediatric and adult populations. The spine alignment need to be quantitively assessed for further treatment planning. However, the current practice requires spine surgeons to manually place landmarks of endplates and key vertebrae. The process is laborious and prone to inter- and intra-rater variance. Thus, the investigators have developed an AI-powered spine alignment assessment system (AlignProCARE) to facilitate clinicians in fast, accurate and consistent analytical results.
The investigators aim to test and improve the performance of the spine alignment auto-analysis in all patients with spinal deformities in multiple centers including Malaysia, China, and Japan
Objectives:
1. Prospectively test the alignment assessment of patients' spinal deformities with whole spine X-rays (both PA and lateral) with the assessment via AlignProCARE.
2. Collect 500 labeled deformity radiographs in both PA and lateral views per center.
3. Use transfer learning to update the current AlignProCARE for scoliosis analysis to form AlignProCARE+. 4 Qualitatively analyse the AlignProCARE+ using an independent dataset.

primary_outcome.description: Coronal Cobb angle of the spinal deformity. The most tilted end vertebrae away from the apex will be used for measurement of the Cobb angle.The anteroposterior radiograph is used to assess

secondary_outcome.description: Thoracic kyphosis T5-12: angle between upper endplate of T5 to lower endplate of T12 in the lateral radiograph
Lumbar lordosis L1-S1: angle between upper endplate of L1 to top of S1 in the lateral radiograph
Pelvic tilt angle measurement in degrees in the lateral radiograph
Sacral slope angle measurement in degrees in the lateral radiograph
Pelvic incidence angle measurement in degrees in the lateral radiograph

Maximum thoracic kyphosis: angle measurement from the upper endplate of most tilted upper end vertebra to the lower endplate of the lower end vertebra of the thoracic spine in the sagittal plane radiograph

arm_group.arm_group_label: All subjects are diagnosed of having a spinal deformity
arm_group.description: Routine care of patients with spinal deformities

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Idiopathic scoliosis, adult deformity (spondylolisthesis, idiopathic kyphosis, kyphoscoliosis, lordoscoliosis)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal for imaging, postoperative patients

overall_official.last_name: Jason Pui Yin Cheung, MD, MS
